message.raw:
I don't see separate boxes for the fingers, just a big box around Val.  I attached a screenshot to the original issue.
I see the val_grasping code starting up in the launch file.

I used meld to double check the urdf and it is the same as the updated one from Stephen Peters.  However, I did also notice that the problem with Val's head drooping when the neck pitch gets too large has returned.  I'll keep looking into it.  I did do an update today, so perhaps I somehow messed it up.
message.html:
I don't see separate boxes for the fingers, just a big box around Val. I attached a screenshot to the original issue. I see the val_grasping code starting up in the launch file.

I used meld to double check the urdf and it is the same as the updated one from Stephen Peters. However, I did also notice that the problem with Val's head drooping when the neck pitch gets too large has returned. I'll keep looking into it. I did do an update today, so perhaps I somehow messed it up.

message.raw:
It's a mystery.  I rebooted and ran the sim and, good news, it could not find an urdf.  So I put in Steve's urdf and then the sim came up.  Another screen shot is attached and I do see orange boxes around the fingers.  Does that look right?

I note that the new urdf does not have the fix for the neck drop behavior, so I will add that in.  

It is so strange, because I saw that the neck drop was back, which suggests I had the new urdf and the file itself looked right, identical in meld with Steve's.  Yet deleting that file did not stop the sim from starting until I did a reboot.

I must have changed something when I updated the sim.  Hopefully it is back to working again.

Thank you so much for your fast responses and help.

I'll check it tomorrow with the solar panel and if the behavior is gone I can, hopefully, mark this as resolved.
message.html:
It's a mystery. I rebooted and ran the sim and, good news, it could not find an urdf. So I put in Steve's urdf and then the sim came up. Another screen shot is attached and I do see orange boxes around the fingers. Does that look right?

I note that the new urdf does not have the fix for the neck drop behavior, so I will add that in.

It is so strange, because I saw that the neck drop was back, which suggests I had the new urdf and the file itself looked right, identical in meld with Steve's. Yet deleting that file did not stop the sim from starting until I did a reboot.

I must have changed something when I updated the sim. Hopefully it is back to working again.

Thank you so much for your fast responses and help.

I'll check it tomorrow with the solar panel and if the behavior is gone I can, hopefully, mark this as resolved.

message.raw: It's OK now; I guess I somehow overwrote the urdf when updating.  Thanks for your help Louise!
message.html: It's OK now; I guess I somehow overwrote the urdf when updating. Thanks for your help Louise!
